channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Abandoned untaxed car, 30th August
item.description:
A car has been abandoned in our private car park for around 3 weeks now. It has been untaxed since March 2025

item.title: Reported for the 3RD TIME still NOT PICKED UP, SOFA ON COUNCIL LAND OUTSIDE 264 WELL HALL ROAD, LEADING TO VERMIN PROBLEM, I WILL CONTACT THE MP IF GREENWICH COUNCIL CONTINUE TO IGNORE THIS, IT HAS NOW BEEN MONTHS, PEOPLE ARE LOOSING HOUSE SALES BECAUSE OF THIS, 30th August
item.description:
Reported for the 3RD TIME still NOT PICKED UP, SOFA ON COUNCIL LAND OUTSIDE 264 WELL HALL ROAD, LEADING TO VERMIN PROBLEM, I WILL CONTACT THE MP IF GREENWICH COUNCIL CONTINUE TO IGNORE THIS, IT HAS NOW BEEN MONTHS, PEOPLE ARE LOOSING HOUSE SALES BECAUSE OF THIS, NEXT STEP SOCIAL MEDIA COMPLAINTS REGARDING LOST HOUSE SALES IN THE AREA BECAUSE GREENWICH COUNCIL REFUSE TO CLEAR A SOFA ON THEIR LAND

item.title: Why are Greenwich Council Refusing to collect a sofa on their land outside residential houses - THIS IS THE 3RD TIME OF HAVING TO REPORT THIS - IT HAS BEEN 2 MONTHS SINCE FIRST REPORTING IT, THIS IS A HEALTH HAZARD FOR VERMIN AND MICE, DO YOUR JOB AND CLEAR IT , NEXT STEP I WILL CONTACT THE LOCAL MP, 30th August

item.title: Hedge over pavement from private property, 30th August
item.description:
There is a hedge at number 75 Fotheringham Road, Enfield that has overgrown onto the pavement, the house is a hmo so tenants cannot do it, it takes over 2 flagstones out of 3 on the pavement so have to walk in the road to get past.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fotheringham Road, Southbury, London

item.title: Flytipping/rubbish, overgrown shrubs behind the shops on firs lane, 30th August
item.description:

item.title: Tree needs pruning to improve visibility for pedestrians using refuge, 30th August
item.description:
The tree on the north side of the refuge / traffic island across Foxgrove Road near the crossroads with Westgate Road needs to be pruned. When trying to cross from north to south, visibility along Foxgrove Road towards the west i.e. where traffic comes from is very poor. You can barely see the 10m to the crossroads.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Foxgrove Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
